title: Balancer - Installation

body.body: Make sure that the engine is securely mounted in an engine stand or properly supported when it is removed from the motorcycle.
If the engine is not correctly supported, it can fall.
Failure to follow the advice above could result in damage to property or serious injury.
Renew locking devices where specified, refer to
Before tightening a fixing using a crow foot spanner adapter, refer to
Use of Crow Foot Spanner Adapters with Torque Wrenches
Observe all torque wrench tightening procedures, refer to
Lubricate and fit the right hand bearing, washer and circlip to the shaft.
Fit the left hand bearing sleeve and circlip to the balancer shaft.
Before you fit the balancer shaft to the crankcase, lubricate the rollers of the needle roller bearing with new engine oil that meets specification API SH (or higher) and JASO MA.
Fit the needle roller bearing and circlip to the balancer shaft.
If the balancer and crankshaft are not correctly aligned, severe engine vibration will occur and cause damage to components.

Locate the balancer to the crankcase. Align the balancer gears and crankshaft as shown in the illustration below and make sure that the bearing circlips locate correctly in their corresponding grooves in the crankcase.
Check that the balancer and crankshaft are correctly aligned before you assemble the crankcase halves.
